SECTION.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"

HEADER.<any>: Header may have many attributes, and are heavly depend on the expected output

TEXT.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"

SPAN.style: Basic style formating enum : Bold, Italic, both, none
SPAN.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"
SPAN.separator?: String used between each element of the span ('' by default)

TITLE.level: Int specifying the level of this title, starting at 1
TITLE.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"

LIST.ordered: Boolean for the type of list
LIST.type?: This character attribute indicates the numbering type: [a: lowercase letters|A: uppercase letters|i: lowercase Roman numerals|I: uppercase Roman numerals|1: numbers]
LIST.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"

LIST_ENTRY.level: Int specifying the indent of the entry, starting at 1
LIST_ENTRY.type?: This character attribute __override__ the numbering type: [a: lowercase letters|A: uppercase letters|i: lowercase Roman numerals|I: uppercase Roman numerals|1: numbers]
LIST_ENTRY.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"
LIST_ENTRY.completed?: Boolean. If set, entry will appear as completable, and will be checked or uncheck depending on the value of the bool

QUOTE.author?: String for the author of the quote
QUOTE.date?: String for the date of the quote
QUOTE.location?: String for the location of the quote
QUOTE.class?: String of classes for style specificiation. E.G. "my-class function-title"

CODE.language: Specify a language for syntaxic coloration

TABLE.headers: List of Contents for each column head

IMAGE.uri: Link to the ressource (can be an URL)
IMAGE.link?: Link this image point toward (when clicking on it)

LINK.internal-link?: Boolean, False by default. If True, means this link points to something within the page
